org.spongepowered.api.world

Interface World

  • All Superinterfaces:
    BiomeVolume, BlockVolume, EntityUniverse, Extent, Viewer, WeatherVolume

    public interface World
extends Extent, Viewer, WeatherVolume
    A loaded Minecraft world

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

    • Method Detail

      • getUniqueID

        java.util.UUID getUniqueID()
        Gets the unique identifier for this world.
        Returns:
        The unique id or UUID

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the name of the world.

        The world name may randomly generated or user-defined. It may or may not be safe to be used in a filename.

        Returns:
        The world name
        See Also:
        A method to get a unique identifier

      • getChunk

        com.google.common.base.Optional<Chunk> getChunk(Vector2i position)
        Get the loaded chunk at the given position.

        If the chunk has not been loaded at the given position, then null will be returned.

        Parameters:
        position - The position
        Returns:
        The chunk, if available

      • loadChunk

        com.google.common.base.Optional<Chunk> loadChunk(Vector2i position,
                                                 boolean shouldGenerate)
        Get the chunk at the given position if it exists or if shouldGenerate is true and the chunk is generated.
        Parameters:
        position - The position
        shouldGenerate - True to generate a new chunk
        Returns:
        The loaded or generated chunk, if already generated

      • loadChunk

        Chunk loadChunk(Vector2i position)
        Get the chunk at the given position if it exists, generating it if the chunk does not exist.
        Parameters:
        position - The position
        Returns:
        The loaded or generated chunk

      • getEntityFromUUID

        com.google.common.base.Optional<Entity> getEntityFromUUID(java.util.UUID uuid)
        Gets the entity whose UUID matches the provided id, possibly returning no entity if the entity is not loaded or non-existant.

        For world implementations, only some parts of the world is usually loaded, so this method may return no entity if the entity is not loaded.

        Parameters:
        uuid - The unique id
        Returns:
        An entity, if available
